messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Picture Books About Dogs
messages.msgSnippet: Hi I m new here but wanted to jump in here as my oldest daughter s favourite subject is animals, dogs in particular.  Her suggestions of good dog books are:
messages.messageBody:
Hi

I'm new here but wanted to jump in here as my oldest daughter's favourite
subject is animals, dogs in particular. Her suggestions of good dog books
are:
"Jess the Border Collie" series by Lucy Daniels
"Floss" and "Just Like Floss" by Kim Lewis
"The Puppy Book" by Camilla Jessel
"The Boxcar Children, Guide Dog Mystery" by Gertrude Chandler Warner
I hope there are useful for you.

I'll send an intro soon :)

Sarah in New Zealand
Wife to marvelous Mike since 26-8-94
Gently mothering and discipling four delightful daughters
Creative Jasmine - 27-11-96
Generous Jessica - 05-06-98
Sweet Chanty - 01-05-00
Cute Chana - 05-09-02

-------Original Message-------

From: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Date: 04/25/04 08:37:50
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Picture Books About Dogs

I'm a dog trainer planning a dog care class for kids. I'm looking
for picture books for 5-10 year olds about dogs that portray them in
a realistic light.

messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/25/04 1:49:59 AM, kara@stjonn.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/25/04 1:49:59 AM, kara@... writes:

<< What about Lynley Dodd's books? (the Hairy MCclarey series) The

language is so rich, it rhymes, beautiful illustrations, real

situations. Wonderful stuff! :) >>

Those are wonderful.

Not as realistic, but good art, are those about the big black uh... (what's
that big black dog? Bigger than a lab, some brown... blanking totally) ...
that carries the baby around when the people aren't home. It's really sweet.
Fictional situation, but really good art.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Picture Books About Dogs
messages.msgSnippet: My kids enjoyed Talk to Your Dog by Jean Craighead George, Paul Meisel (Illustrator), Sue Truesdell (Illustrator).   It s about using your body language (and
messages.messageBody:
My kids enjoyed Talk to Your Dog by Jean Craighead George, Paul Meisel
(Illustrator), Sue Truesdell (Illustrator). It's about using your body
language (and the dog's) to communicate with your dog. Deirdre

messages.subject: Picture Books About Dogs
messages.msgSnippet: I m a dog trainer planning a dog care class for kids.  I m looking for picture books for 5-10 year olds about dogs that portray them in a realistic light.  I
messages.messageBody:
I'm a dog trainer planning a dog care class for kids. I'm looking
for picture books for 5-10 year olds about dogs that portray them in
a realistic light. I already have "Some Swell Pup" by Sendak as an
intro. Books can be fiction or non-fiction and on any doggy topic
but well written. Anyone have any good suggestions?

Holly
2 COOL 4 SCHOOL
Unschooling T-shirts
http://www.cafepress.com/2cool4school
